dataaccess

Class PCRBroker

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataaccess.PCRBroker

  • public class PCRBroker
extends java.lang.Object
    Broker class which communicates with JDBC and handles all the Password Change Recovery information management.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String delete(PasswordChangeRequest pcr)
      Deletes the PasswordChangeRequest object information from the database
      PasswordChangeRequest getByUUID(java.lang.String pcrUUID)
      Gets the PasswordChangeRequest from the pcrUUID string
      static PCRBroker getInstance()
      Singleton method which gets the PCRBroker instance.
      java.lang.String insert(PasswordChangeRequest pcr)
      Inserts the PasswordChangeRequest object information to the database

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static PCRBroker getInstance()
        Singleton method which gets the PCRBroker instance.
        Returns:
        the PCRBroker instance

      • getByUUID

        public PasswordChangeRequest getByUUID(java.lang.String pcrUUID)
        Gets the PasswordChangeRequest from the pcrUUID string
        Parameters:
        pcrUUID - the uuid string
        Returns:
        the found PasswordChangeRequest, or null if unexpected issue occurred.

      • insert

        public java.lang.String insert(PasswordChangeRequest pcr)
        Inserts the PasswordChangeRequest object information to the database
        Parameters:
        pcr - the PasswordChangeRequest object
        Returns:
        "inserted" if everything went ok, "error" if there was an expected issue, "exception" if there was an unexpected issue.

      • delete

        public java.lang.String delete(PasswordChangeRequest pcr)
        Deletes the PasswordChangeRequest object information from the database
        Parameters:
        pcr - the PasswordChangeRequest object to delete
        Returns:
        "deleted" if everything went ok, "error" if there was an expected issue, "exception" or null if there was an unexpected issue.
